Vulnerability.Title: pesign bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The pesign packages contain the pesign utility for signing UEFI binaries, as well as other associated tools. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the manual pages of the pesign utility omitted certain options and contained some invalid options. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and the pesign manual pages are now accurate and complete. (BZ#948850) Prior to this update, position-independent executable (PIE) code and RELocation Read-Only (RELRO) was missing from the binaries of the pesign packages. With this update, all pesign binaries are hardened with PIE and RELRO flags. (BZ#1092542) Previously, due to the use of the ExclusiveArch tag in the pesign spec file, the pesign packages failed to build for the 64-bit ARM (AArch64) architecture. This update adds AArch64 to the ExclusiveArch list, and pesign now builds correctly for all architectures. (BZ#1100042) Users of pesign are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
